These days are the peak of the
dry season in Go Cong Dong district and Tan
Phu Dong district, Tien Giang province. Most of the
canals have dried up, many rural areas
are seriously lacking fresh water.  To
help people ease difficulties, the

water pipelines and installed 40 clean water taps in
public places for people to use for
free at noon. Mr. Duong Anh Phung sleeps in Kiem
Phuoc commune, Go Cong district  Dong drove a tow truck
carrying 10 30-liter plastic cans
to the public water tap near his house,
headed back to the family for cooking, bathing, and washing.
Now the menstrual water is too dry, it's
polluted, and now there's nothing to drink.  In
general, now I just save money for the four heads,
but I don't want to go out to do activities like bathing, doing
laundry or something like that. Even if I work, I can't
face the other side of the canal.
Huu Phuoc's family has always used
canal water for drinking purposes.  However,
recently, salt water has infiltrated the
polluted canal water, so it is impossible to pump it up and
use his family's dry water tanks.
That is also the general situation of
about 3,000 households in the coastal area of
Tien Giang province.  Currently, in addition to the 40
clean water taps that have been installed, localities are
urgently installing 50 more taps to
bring clean water as close to the people as possible so that no
household has to have clean water during this dry season.
